Resources

Source: vignettes/resources.Rmd
resources.Rmd

Please use the blavaan discussion group for all questions/issues related to blavaan. This can be found at

https://groups.google.com/d/forum/blavaan

Other resources are listed below:

  • Materials from the 2024 NCME workshop titled Bayesian latent variable modeling in education research. pdf R

  • The lavaan resources page is helpful for model specification examples; it is mostly the same specification that is used in blavaan, and the main blavaan commands just add the letter “b” to the start of the main lavaan commands.

  • “Getting started with blavaan” materials by Rens van de Schoot and colleagues: html

  • A Stan case study on blavaan, by Feng Ji and colleagues: html

  • Many recorded presentations are available on the internet:

    • The longest talk with the most details: Presentation to the Oslo UseR Group, including real-time coding examples near the end. (Code from those examples is here.)

    • Details about how the package works: A virtual presentation to the 2022 International Workshop on Psychometric Computing.

    • An episode of the Learning Bayesian Statistics podcast, discussing blavaan and related topics.

    • Basic overview of the package: useR! 2020 virtual presentation (done early in the pandemic, and demonstrating the author’s poor video editing skills.)

  • Slides from an hour-long seminar presentation to the Michigan State Methods Group, October, 2021.

  • Slides (blavaan and others) from a symposium on the lavaan ecosystem at the 2019 International Meeting of the Psychometric Society, Santiago, Chile.

Developed by Edgar Merkle, Yves Rosseel, Ben Goodrich.

Site built with pkgdown 2.1.0.
